name: INTERNATIONAL METHIONINE ANALOGUE ASSOCIATION
membership: Member of AOAC International (THE ASSOCIATION OF ANALYTICAL COMMUNITIES), of ASAS (AMERICAN SOCIETY OF ANIMAL SCIENCE), of SFM (SOCIETE FRANCAISE DE MICROBIOLOGIE), of AFCA-CIAL (Association des Fabricants de Compléments et fournisseurs d'Additifs et ingrédients fonctionnels pour l'Alimentation Animale), of CEN/TC327 (European Committee for Standardization)
goal:
- promote the reputation, utilization and dissemination of hydroxy analogue of methionine (2-hydroxy-4-methylthio-butanoic acid, “HMTBa”) in agricultural, industrial, human and other applications;
- represent, defend and promote the interests of the HTMBa sector to the general public and to the institutions of jurisdictions where this product is used including those of the European Union;
- lobby for workable local legislative frameworks, their implementation and for non-binding codes of conducts applicable to HTMBa;
- develop for HMTBa, professional rules and best manufacturing and labeling practices, together with other associations, stakeholders and institutions of jurisdictions where this product is used;
- organize events and seminars and publish materials on the efficient use and regulation of HTMBa; and
- encourage and finance scientific research on HTMBa, including but not limited to its metabolism and functionality in livestock production, seeking to enhance the HTMBa sector’s capacity to innovate, and/or to transfer science and technology based solutions, in agricultural, industrial, human and other applications.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Business and Industry, Competition, Customs, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: IMAA activity are just starting. Here are the areas of activity being targeted: Regulation (EC) No 767/2009, Directive 2008/38/EC, Regulation (EC) No 1831/2003, Regulation (EC) No 429/2008, all the corresponding EFSA guidance, all the work done by european reference laboratory in terms of harmonized feed additives methods of analysis and expertises.
